articles.description: Why Brendon McCullum must heed his own advice as England's post-Ashes era begins with a white-ball series in Sri Lanka.
articles.title: Brendon McCullum's future under scrutiny as England prepare for white-ball series in Sri Lanka

articles.description: France striker Jean-Philippe Mateta has 18 months remaining on his current deal at Selhurst Park and as things stand he will not be signing an extension.
articles.title: Crystal Palace striker Jean-Philippe Mateta tells club he wants to leave

articles.description: After Emma Raducanu suffered a humbling second-round exit, BBC Sport analyses what went wrong and where the Briton goes from here.
articles.title: Australian Open 2026: Emma Raducanu loses in second round - what went wrong?

articles.description: Rory McIlroy says Tyrrell Hatton and Jon Rahm can "prove" their commitment to Europe's Ryder Cup team by settling the fines handed down to them by the DP World Tour.
articles.title: DP World Tour: Rory McIlroy challenges Tyrrell Hatton and Jon Rahm to pay fines

articles.description: France's all-time top try-scorer Damian Penaud is a shock omission from the defending champions' Six Nations squad.
articles.title: Damian Penaud: Star wing left out of France Six Nations squad

articles.description: With the PGA Tour going on the offensive, how hard LIV's paymasters fight to keep Bryson DeChambeau may well go a long way to dictating the future credibility of its series, writes Dan Roan.
articles.title: LIV Golf: What does the future hold after Brooks Koepka departure?

articles.description: Ulster captain Iain Henderson has been left out of Ireland's 37-strong squad for the Six Nations but Nathan Doak and Edwin Edogbo are included.
articles.title: Six Nations 2026: Iain Henderson out of Ireland squad as Nathan Doak included

articles.description: The Bangladesh Cricket Board's demand to move their matches at next month's Twenty20 World Cup has been rejected by the ICC.
articles.title: Bangladesh's request to move T20 World Cup games rejected by ICC

articles.description: The Manchester City squad will refund the ticket costs for 374 supporters who travelled to Norway to witness their side's shock 3-1 Champions League defeat at Bodo/Glimt on Tuesday.
articles.title: Manchester City: Squad to refund ticket costs for fans after Champions League loss

articles.description: Meet Callum Walsh, the Irishman tasked with kicking off Zuffa Boxing and living up to being Dana White's first boxer.
articles.title: Boxing: Meet Callum Walsh, Dana White's favourite boxer as Zuffa Boxing launches
